ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: In class and on the web discussions are very inspiring.
It seems tangential, but a understanding of religion and ecology is to everyone's understanding of environmentalism in the various cultures.

Professors Tucker and Grim didn't just write the book on Religion and Ecology, they helped establish the field. There just are not two better people to learn from on these issues. They are so attentive to student thinking and discussion. The readings were well-organized and clear.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Better interface of the online course.
Timing - making the reading responses due earlier.

I'm never particularly fond of online discussion posting, but I will say that this class was probably the most effective use of it that I've seen. People were more than civilthey were positive and helpful, and it was a good way to reflect further on ideas learned in lecture or reading.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, but it would make for more likely discussions if postings on the lectures were due before the discussion section.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: Interest in how religions affect environmentalism.
I don't have a lot of experience with religion and ecology, and I wanted to learn the basics from the best. I got exactly what I'd hoped for.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, very much satisfy my curiosity on religious ecology.
Definitely. I have a better understanding of how religions can be involved to effect positive ecological change.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you have a lot of practical classes, as in environmental science or policy, it is useful to take this course because it gives you a different perspective on viewing ecology and environmentalism.

Just have fun, and don't be afraid of the flipped course format. Online course does not mean the instructors are not attentive. Discussions in person are wonderful, and online resources are convenient.
